name: The Kyiv-Pechersk Assumption Cathedral
generalDescription: The coins are dedicated to restoration of the Assumption Cathedral of the Kyiv-Pechersk Lavra monastery, the outstanding historical and cultural monument of Ukraine of the 11th-18th centuries
averseDescription: On the coin obverse of all the coins from this series within the frame of a baroque ornament decorated with seraphim`s heads there is a depiction of the small National Emblem of Ukraine and a four line legend: on the gold coin - УКРАЇНА, 100 ГРИВЕНЬ, 1998 (Ukraine/ 100/hryvnia/1998) and the designation of the metal- Au 900, its fineness, and 15,55, the coin weight in fineness; on the silver coin - УКРАЇНА, 10 ГРИВЕНЬ, 1998 (Ukraine/ 10/hryvnia/1998) and the designation of the metal- Ag 925, its fineness, and 31,1, the coin weight in fineness; on the German silver coin - УКРАЇНА, 5 ГРИВЕНЬ 1998 (Ukraine/ 5 /hryvnia/1998)
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse of all the coins from this series there are depicted the Assumption Cathedral destroyed in 1941 and its ruins, as well as the inscription: УСПЕНСЬКИЙ СOБОР КИЄВО-ПЕЧЕРСЬКОЇ ЛАВРИ Х1 СТ.( the Kyiv-Pechersk Assumption Cathedral of the 11th century)
